questions.label:
The UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) requires that we ask you some additional quesitons to better understand your financial circumstances and serve you.

The FCA prescribes three investor categories. Most customers will fit into the Restricted Investor category - please don't let the name put you off - this category is sufficient for most customers.

The questions are about your current circumstances so you can disregard anything you have told us previously.

This categorisation is entirely self declared - Solidi will not be asking for proof / documentation of these statements.
Which type of investor are you?
questions.guidance: Please choose the investor type which best describes you.

questions.label: The UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) divide investors into three categories. Please choose the investor type which best describes you.

values.text:
Restricted investor
You've invested less than 10% of your net worth in high risk assets (such as Crypto) over the last 12 months, and you intend to limit such investments to less than 10% in the year ahead.

High-Net-Worth investor
You've an annual income of at least £100,000 or assets of at least £250,000.

Certified-Sophisticated investor
You're recevied a certificate in the last three years from an authorised firm confirming that you understand the risks of crypto investing.

None of the above
If none of the above apply then unfortunately the FCA will not allow us to provide you with an account.

questions.label: Restricted investor

Putting all your money into a single business or type of investment is risky. Spreading your money across different investments makes you less dependent on any one to do well.

Your should not invest more than 10% of your net assets in high-risk investments. Doing so could expose you to significant losses.

For the purposes of this statement, net assets do NOT include: your home (primary residence), your pension (or any pension withdrawals) or any rights under qualifying contracts of insurance.

For the purposes of this statement, high-risk investments are: peer-to-peer (P2P) loans; investment based crowdfunding; and unlisted debt and equity (such as in companies not listed on an exchange like the London Stock Exchange).
Restricted investor

Please confirm whether you quality as a restricted investor on the basis that A and B apply to you.

A) In the past twelve months have you invested less than 10% of your net assets in high-risk investments (as defined on previous page)?

values.text: Yes (I have invested less than 10% of my net assets)
No (I have invested more than 10% of my net assets)

questions.validationmsg: To qualify as a restricted investor you must have invested 10% of less of your assets in high risk investments

questions.label: If yes, over the last twelve months roughly what percentage of your net assets have you invested in high-risk investments (as defined in previous page)?
questions.validationmsg: To qualify as a restricted investor you cannot have invested more than 10%

questions.label: B) In the next twelve months do you intend to limit your investment in high-risk (as defined on previous page) to less than 10% of your net assets?

values.text: Yes (I intend to invest less than 10% of my net assets)
No (I intend to invest more than 10% of my net assets)

questions.validationmsg: To qualify as a restricted investor you must commit to investing 10% of less of your assets in high risk investments in the next 12 months

questions.label: If yes, in the next twelve months roughly what percentage of your net assets do you intend to invest in high-risk investments (as defined in previous page)?
questions.validationmsg: To qualify as a restricted investor you cannot have invested more than 10%

questions.label: Restricted investor

I accept that being a restricted investor will expose me to promotions for investment where there is a risk of losing all the money I invest.

I am aware that it is open to me to seek professional advice before making any investment in a high-risk investment.
Signed
questions.validationmsg: To qualify as a restricted investor you cannot have invested more than 10%

questions.label: Date
questions.validationmsg: To qualify as a restricted investor you cannot have invested more than 10%

questions.label: High-Net-Worth investor

Please confirm whether you quality as a high-net-worth investor on the basis that A or B apply to you.

In the last financial year did you have:

A) an annual income of £100,000 or more? Income does NOT include any one off pension withdraws.
If yes, please specify your income (as defined above) to the nearest £10,000 in the last financial year.
B) net assets of £250,000 or more? Net assets do NOT include: your home (primary residence), your pension (or any pension withdraws) or any rights under qualifying contracts of insurance.
If yes, please specify your net assets (as defined above) to the nearest £100,000 in the last financial year.
High Net Worth investor

I accept that being a high-net-worth investor will expose me to promotions for investment where there is a significant risk of losing all the money I invest.

I am aware that it is open to me to seek professional advice before making any investment in a high-risk investment.
Signed
Date
Sophisticated investor

Please confirm whether you quality as a sophisticated investor on the basis that in the last three years you have received a certificate from an authorised firm confirming that you understand the risks involved with crypto investment.

questions.validationmsg: To qualify as a sophisticated investor you must select 'Yes'

questions.label: If yes, what was the name of the authorised firm?.
questions.guidance: You must supply the name of the authorised firm

questions.label: High Net Worth investor

I accept that being a high-net-worth investor will expose me to promotions for investment where there is a significant risk of losing all the money I invest.

I am aware that it is open to me to seek professional advice before making any investment in a high-risk investment.
